text:
The postscript generated by FOP is missing "FOPFonts end" after "showpage" at
each page. This causes the postscript viewer/printer to use huge amounts of
memory for large documents.

We set PS as outdata (not PRINTER).

We user the following sed script to fix it after the transformation.
sed 's/showpage/showpage FOPFonts end/'
And then it works.

Out version of fop is 20.1
creator: melker@unit.liu.se
qha@unit.liu.se
text:
After upgrading fop to version 0.20.4 we've now had to alter the workaround to 

sed 's/showpage/showpage FOPFonts end FOPprocs end/'

as there is now also an unterminated FOPprocs begin on each page.

With only the previous fix gv is unable to display pages after page 505 for our
files, without any help gv is unable to display pages after page 253.

creator: qha@unit.liu.se
text:
After learning a bit more about postscript in i've changed the substitution
again, this time to sed 's/showpage/showpage end end/', leaving far less junk on
the stack.

Fixed in CVS. I've fixed it in another way than you suggested. I moved the 
proc begins to the end of the Setup section so they are only executed once. 
Please reopen the entry here if it didn't work for you.
creator: jeremias@apache.org
qha@unit.liu.se
text:
After getting the latest sources from anonymous cvs, updating to the maintenance
branch and updating PSRenderer.java a bit more (plus some file javac complained
about) I think I've managed to test your patch and it certainly seems to solve
the problem.

If I knew how you use verified and closed I'd probably mark this bug as one of
those, but I'll just leave that to you.

Thanks for your help!

PS. Am I correct in assuming this patch will be included in 0.20.5 when it's
done? DS.

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text:
To mark a bug use the radio buttons ("Mark bug as...") right above the commit 
button.

And yes, the bugfix will be in 0.20.5. I'm glad it worked and thanks for 
confirming.
